New critters and new ideas are arriving every day at the Newleaf train station! Attract eager visitors to your city, make your reservations, travel further with tickets, and build the most prosperous city Everdell has ever seen! Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.
Lurking in the depths of Mistwood, the cunning and villainous Nightweave plots to take over Everdell with the aid of her spiderlings. Pit your wits against Nightweave and her sticky schemes in both solo and two-player games, and recruit heroes of yore from our More Legends and Corrin Evertail expansion packs as well as transform your farms with our new Through Every Season expansion pack!

Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.
Dive tailfirst into the world of Everdell with the Complete Collection. Build a city of critters and constructions and explore the Emerald Valley and beyond; celebrate the Bellfaire, wonder at Newleaf’s mechanical marvels, trek into the Spirecrest Mountains, explore the underwater depths of Pearlbrook, and chance the dangers of Mistwood. Play against automated opponents including the dastardly Rugwort and cunning Nightweave, meet heroes of renown in our Legends II and Corrin Evertail expansion packs, and find abundance in new farms in our Through Every Season expansion pack. Everdell is easy to learn, yet offers satisfying strategic depth and endless replayability.

Will the sun shine brightest on your city?
Artist impression of prototype components. Final version subject to updates.

New to Everdell?
Check out this great How to Play video from Watch it Played!
Within the charming valley of Everdell, beneath the boughs of towering trees, among meandering streams and mossy hollows, a civilization of forest critters is thriving and expanding... Everdell is a game of dynamic tableau building and worker placement played over four seasons. Whoever makes the most impressive city wins! 

On your turn, you can take one of three actions:
a) Place a Meeple: You have a collection of wooden Critter meeples. You can place these on the board locations, events, and on Destination cards. Critter meeples allow you to perform various actions to develop your city: gathering resources, drawing cards, and taking other special actions.
b) Play a Card: Each player is building and populating a city; a tableau of up to 15 Construction and Critter cards. There are five types of cards: Travelers, Production, Destination, Governance, and Prosperity. Cards generate resources (twigs, resin, pebbles, and berries), grant abilities, and ultimately score points. The interactions of the cards reveal numerous strategies and a near infinite variety of working cities.
c) Prepare for the next Season: Critter meeples are returned to your supply and you gain bonuses depending on the season. The game is played from one year’s winter through to the end of autumn. Players add up the points from their cards and other bonuses and whoever has the highest total wins!
New content that will delight and surprise you for many more seasons to come!
Golden Occupied Tokens
The new Critter and Construction cards in Newleaf are played like normal Critter and Construction cards from the base game, except that you use Golden Occupied tokens instead of normal occupied tokens. These Golden Occupied tokens are limited -- a player can never use more than 3 in a game! These new cards are very powerful, so choose wisely which you'll spend your Golden Occupied tokens on! 

Through Every Season Cards
Since the beginning of Everdell’s history, farming has been a vital part of the valley’s way of life. Farmers face a number of challenges through the four distinct seasons of the year and must adapt as the weather changes. Experience the story of an Everdell farm throughout the year!
The 8 new special Farm cards in Mistwood replace the basic Farms in your Everdell game. These often give you the choice of two abilities, and you choose which of these abilities to use each time the card activates.

More Legends
Legendary cards represent unique Critters and Constructions that are powerful upgrades of other Critters and Constructions. Use them when you are familiar with the base game, and are looking forward to a twist on a regular game! The More Legends cards in Mistwood are added into a game of Everdell in the same manner as the Legends from Everdell: Collector's Edition.
New ideas are arriving every day!
Station Cards
Faceup Critter and Construction cards on the Station board work like Meadow cards and may be played on your turn, but whenever you play a card from the Station, also gain the reward listed on the Train Car tile beside the card! This reward is gained after you have fully resolved the played card and any additional cards that may have activated as a result. After you've gained the reward, replenish both the Train Car tile and the card played.
Remember: cards on the Station board are not Meadow cards, and therefore any abilities that affect Meadow cards (such as the Inn) do not apply to Station cards!

Visitors
Newleaf is a bustling and growing city in Everdell, and now that the railway system is in full operation, many new critters and big ideas are coming into the Emerald Valley. The Visitor cards that come into play on the Station Board offer players a new end game scoring opportunity!
To gain a Visitor card on your turn:
Place a worker on the Station. The Station is a shared location, allowing several workers at once, but you may only have 1 of your workers on this location at a time.
Choose 1 of the faceup Visitor cards and discard it facedown on the Visitor discard pile.
Reveal 1 new Visitor card and choose 1 of the 2 faceup Visitor cards to take and place by your city. If you do not want either of the faceup Visitors, you may draw 1 from the top of the Visitor deck instead. If you selected one of the faceup Visitors, replace its card with another one from the Visitor deck.
Gain the reward shown on 1 of the Train Car tiles by the Station; set that tile aside and draw a replacement tile.
Visitor cards will score their listed point values, if your city contains their requirements at the end of the game. Visitor cards that you have obtained and failed to please (by not meeting their requirements) are not worth any points at the end of the game.

The Knoll
You may place a worker on the Knoll to choose any 3 cards from the Meadow and/or the Station to discard. Replenish the discarded cards from the main deck, and draw any 3 cards into your hand from the Meadow and/or the Station. After drawing your cards, you may then gain the reward shown on 1 of the Train Car tiles. Set that Train Car tile aside and draw a replacement tile from the bag. Finally, replenish the 3 cards you drew into your hand.
The Knoll is a shared location, allowing several workers at once, but you may only have 1 of your workers on this location at a time.
Everdell has a brand new villainess!
Now while playing Everdell, you can pit your wits against Nightweave, our newest automated player for solitaire and two-player games. Nightweave is designed to function like a real player at your table: she has her own hand of cards, Prepares for Seasons on her own schedule, and, most importantly, she has her own agenda!

Nightweave has her own Big Critter meeple along with 8 spider meeples (not just 6!) that will move about the board to do her bidding -- blocking exclusive Locations, taking events away before you can get them, and even enacting Plots and Plans that will interfere with your options as a player, reminiscent of the Weather cards from Spirecrest.  She has eight different personalities that influence what she targets and focuses on, so there's lots of variety in gameplay!

What Happens on Nightweave's Turn?
Turn over the top card of Nightweave's Activity deck. These cards are the heart of her decision-making during the game, instructing her to play cards into her city, place spider meeples on previous, exclusive Locations, take a Basic or Special event, etc.
Nightweave will perform the first action listed for her current season, if possible. If she cannot perform this action for any reason, she will take the second action for her current season. If she cannot take that action either, she will perform as much of the Default action at the bottom of the card as she can. This could include discarding cards, collecting point tokens (yes, really!), and/or a number of other actions.
If Nightweave herself is in the Meadow and there are no spiderlings left in her lair when she draws an Activity card with a Spider or Nightweave icon, she will Prepare for Season. 
The game ends when you run out of actions and when Nightwave Prepares for Season at the end of Autumn.

Can you stop Nightweave from taking over Everdell? Check out the Rulebook for more in-depth information about this automated player!

Presenting the sixth book in our ART OF DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN series!
DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN: PERILOUS GARDEN
Prior to COVID-19 and HIV/AIDS, the last pandemic the world experienced was the devastating influenza of 1918-1920. Germany was already decimated by the First World War, and the Spanish Flu ravaged the country from border to border. It was during these unsettling years that the world's first horror-fantasy magazine was published.
Published in Munich from 1919-1921, DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN was a predecessor to the American pulp Weird Tales, and is considered the first horror-fantasy-science fiction periodical. The series collected macabre and mysterious tales from the finest European literary minds, from well-known names like H. G. Wells to now-obscure titans like Hanns Heinz Ewers. Many of the stories have been collected and translated over the years, so in this series of books we focus on the artworks, nearly all of which have remained unpublished for a century.

Grotesque medieval etchings representing the human relationship with death, strange occult woodblocks that consider what lies just beyond the veil of human understanding, and sinister Expressionist visions as tangible manifestations of anxiety.

From our current perspective of global uncertainty and the looming presence of a deadly, devastating virus, the artworks and stories of DER ORCHIDEENGARTEN -created in the same climate, a century ago– are uncannily resonant today.
Founded four years before the iconic American magazine Weird Tales launched in March 1923, Der Orchideengarten was published immediately after the First World War, when German art was at its height of decadence and debauchery. The magazine included copious illustrations of themes ranging from suspense and terror to crime and the eerily-erotic. The stories were written by the European counterparts of H. P. Lovecraft and Arthur Machen, and the artworks were by artists both well-known and painfully obscure: Heinrich Kley, for example, was Disney's inspiration for Night on Bald Mountain in his film Fantasia, and is one of the artists well-represented in the magazine. The stories have been reprinted and translated over the past century, but the artworks remain undiscovered treasures– until now.
Rewards: The Book 
PERILOUS GARDEN: The Art of Der Orchideengarten Vol. 6 is the sixth book in our 'Art of Der Orchideengarten' series, and the third of three volumes completely documenting the magnificent and macabre artworks from the year 1920 of Der Orchideengarten magazine, the legendary German supernatural horror periodical published from January 1919 until November 1921.
PERILOUS GARDEN: The Art of Der Orchideengarten Vol. 6

contains every artwork from issues 16-24, published in the year 1920
The magazines were printed with letterpress debossing, creating rich, dense text and images; we are capturing the artworks in ultra-high, crisp resolution for maximum detail.

 Custom folios featuring handmade marbled paper created by Brazilian artist Renato Crepaldi, specifically designed for our Art of Der Orchideengarten series.
An extremely limited edition of 25 print folios were created for each volume (five for the complete volume sets and twenty for individual sale).
Add ons
If you missed the first five books in this series, which document the complete artworks of Der Orchideengarten magazine from the year 1919 and 1920, there are special pledge levels for you to get ALL SIX volumes - Perilous Garden, Malevolent Visions, Withering Heights, Eldritch Bloom, Sinister Harvest, and Diabolical Fantasia!

If you need to fill in specific gaps in your series collection, the PERILOUS GARDEN t-shirt and all of the books, pins, and postcard sets from Vol. 1-6 will be available as add-ons in the project survey. If you would rather increase your pledge amount now to cover the add-on items you want, please look at your total amount (initial pledge + shipping) and add $27 per t-shirt/$25 per book/$10 per postcard set/$10 per pin/$35 per Patronage Print to cover the additional items you want - then just send us a message telling us which specific items you want to receive!

 ABOUT US 
For over 20 years, Century Guild has been devoted to building and presenting an archive of important artworks that define the origins of popular culture. We've prepared the materials, and by pre-ordering a copy of the book and spreading the word, you can help us make a documentation of this very rare and very obscure magazine come to life. Der Orchideengarten gets mentioned frequently in books, at fantasy conventions, and at certain full-moon cauldron gatherings–but the same low-resolution images get shared over and over again. This book is an opportunity to explore the artworks in depth, with synopses and snippets of the stories, and high resolution scans made from a pristine collection. We love tactile experiences, and in a hyper-stimulating digital era there is nothing more meditative than thoughtfully turning the pages of a well-crafted book. With your help, we can perpetuate this romantic educational experience.
Founded in 1999 by Thomas Negovan, Century Guild has presented Art Nouveau and Symbolist Art in both their Chicago (1999-2013) and Los Angeles (2012-2018) galleries, as well as in numerous international art and antiques fairs across the last two decades- including fourteen years as a major presence at San Diego Comic Con International. Works previously in the Century Guild collection are on permanent display in a number of important institutions, including The Art Institute of Chicago, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, and The Detroit Institute of Art and have been exhibited at The Los Angeles County Museum of Art, The Minneapolis Museum of Art, and The Art Gallery of Ontario. The limited edition books published by Century Guild are desirable for their academic content, fine quality, and collectability; many out-of-print volumes command high prices on the secondary market.

Thank you for your support of our mission to document and preserve rare, obscure, and historically important artworks!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Stronghold Games' previous success and the assistance and guidance of the experts we are working with will enable us to deliver this project on time. We have every confidence that Ares Expedition will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Stronghold Games will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY
We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds 14 days after the close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS
We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.

RETURNED PRODUCTS
If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.

FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY
Surveys will be completed through Crowd Ox. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a few months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

updates.update_content:
Hello backers!

As you may have seen, shipping has started in the US & EU and some packages have already arrived in both regions. Packages are being assembled in Asia, and shipments from the US to Canada, and EU to UK fulfilment centers have started their journey.

However, before we go over those shipping details, we want to acknowledge that we hear your feedback. This community has made it clear that we misstepped in the way we conveyed the information about the Target release and our inability to get your games out before then.  We should have made this known earlier, but we didn’t.

Tomorrow (Sunday), Target will launch an exclusive edition of Ares Expedition across all their US stores. This is an exciting moment for us as a company even as it is disappointing that we weren’t able to get backer rewards out before Target’s June 20th release date, that were unable to modify once agreed upon. Our original production and shipping dates gave us time to get backers rewards out before this date. Unfortunately we weren’t able to predict the significant supply chain and production issues related to COVID restrictions around the world. We apologize that we weren’t able to hit our original planned dates that would have had most of you playing your copies by now.

Good news terraformers! Our first containers are through customs and your games will arrive later this week in the US and EU fulfilment centers. Once those arrive, we will forward the first set of games to the UK and Canadian fulfilment centers.  Games for Asia, Australia and rest of the world have already arrived and packing them for the regional hubs has already begun.

We will start sending games to you just as soon as they arrive at your fulfilment center.  Keep in mind that this will be a rolling fulfillment and second containers for each region have been delayed by a couple of weeks and are currently three weeks behind the first containers. That means it will be at least six weeks from when the first shipping notice goes out before the last does, and that shipping will start in the US and EU before UK & Canada by at least two weeks given intrar-egion current transit times.  Rolling fulfillment will get games to everyone faster, but it will be a source of frustration for some.  We apologize in advance if your order is later than the others.

updates.update_userinfo: Closing in on Fulfillment! Locking addresses on June 4th!
updates.update_content:
Expeditioners, we’ve been hard at work tying up some logistics and shipping issues and the good news is that  we’re nearing the final step of this campaign. There are still a few hurdles between now and you getting your games but we’re way ahead of our original projection of shipping in September.

So the short update is that your copies of Ares Expedition are now on ships heading to the fulfillment centers!  While that is well ahead of our original schedule, this actually is a couple of weeks later than we were expecting. Over the last few weeks there have been significant delays. The first delay was some minor retooling of the dual-layer player boards, to tighten up the spaces that a few eagle eyed backers noticed in our update photos.  This will make the player mats more usable, but it did add a few weeks to our production time. We wanted to make sure these were high quality, and that meant making some changes so this delay was the right call.

Expeditionists,
I come bearing good news! Printing is progressing well and we are ahead of schedule.  This might not be the most exciting update as the production process churns along, however, we did want to take a moment to show you the production sample of the sleeves in action.  They came out great!

campaign.story:
The Labyrinth - Standard Edition
A world covered by ruins and ash, the remnants of an otherwordly phenomenon that has ravaged the earth’s atmosphere and forced the few survivors deep underground. Matt, Sigrid and Charlie leave the safe harbor of the enclave for an expedition onto the wastelands of the surface world. During their journey they are forced to confront dark secrets from the time before civilization’s fall.
Simon Stålenhag is the internationally acclaimed author, concept designer and artist behind Tales From the Loop, Things From the Flood and The Electric State. His highly imaginative images and stories depicting illusive sci-fi phenomena in mundane, hyper-realistic Scandinavian landscapes have made Stålenhag one of the most sought-after visual storytellers in the world.
Now, Stålenhag turns his unique vision to a dystopic future in a new narrative artbook: The Labyrinth. With your support, these amazing images will turn into a top-quality narrative artbook, truly doing justice to the extreme attention to detail and quality of Stålenhag's work.
Spread from the Labyrinth
Spread from The Labyrinth
Just like Tales From the Loop and Things From the Flood and The Electric State, The Labyrinth will be a thick, oversized artbook of over 150 pages with print, paper, and binding of the highest quality.
There will be two versions of the book - the Standard Edition (included in the STANDARD reward level) and the Limited Edition (included in the LIMITED reward level and above).
The Limited Edition, with an exclusive and beautifully embossed cloth cover, is unique to this kickstarter and will never be printed again.

Simon Stålenhag (b. 1984) is the internationally acclaimed author and artist behind Tales From the Loop and Things From the Flood and The Electric State. His highly imaginative images and stories depicting illusive sci-fi phenomena in mundane, hyper-realistic Scandinavian and American landscapes have made Stålenhag one of the most sought-after visual storytellers in the world. Tales From the Loop was ranked one of the “10 Best Dystopias” by The Guardian, along with such works as Franz Kafka’s The Trial and Andrew Niccol’s Gattaca.
In 2019 his book The Electric State was shortlisted for the Arthur C. Clare Award and the Locus Award. His first book, Tales From the Loop, was adapted into a tv show on Amazon Prime in 2020.

campaign.story:
You have just received “The Shelley Volumes,” a collection of hollowed-out books left by Mary Shelley (author of Frankenstein) to her son, Florence. In the first volume, you find a message from Mary:
Beneath Mary’s letter you’ll discover a treasure trove of gorgeous hand-written documents, 2D and 3D jigsaw puzzles, mysterious objects and artifacts, and devious challenges. Prove your worth by studying the documents, constructing the jigsaws, and solving the puzzles... and you’ll be treated to a heartbreaking story that culminates in a shocking reimagining of the truth behind Mary Shelley’s famous novel.
Combining the best of escape rooms, board games, and immersive theater, Mother of Frankenstein is a 10-15 hour cooperative gaming experience for between 1 and 6 players, ages 13 and up. Mother of Frankenstein was designed to be as welcoming and fun for newbies as it is rewarding for experts, combining the narrative complexity of a good novel with the physicality and challenge of a puzzle-filled escape room. Throw in a couple of clue-strewn jigsaw puzzles, and our game truly has something for everyone!
Our final stretch(es)!
Stretchy!
Mother of Frankenstein is divided into three volumes. Volume 1 concerns Mary’s teenage years and her education by her iconoclastic father. Players must complete three assignments—poetry, music, and astronomy—each of which is presented in the form of a puzzle. Simultaneously, Mary embarks on a love affair with the dashing (but married) poet Percy Shelley. The course of their courtship is laid out over 15 love letters, though players must read closely to determine the order of events!
In Volume 2, the venue changes to Germany, and Castle Frankenstein, where a fancy ball is being thrown on a balmy night in 1814. Players begin by constructing a 300-piece jigsaw puzzle of the castle’s floorplan, then use it—along with gossip rags, billiard hall schedules, and original drawings by comic book artist Liana Kangas—to track the events of the evening.
Finally, in Volume 3, you’ll construct an epic 3D puzzle of Castle Frankenstein and descend into the secret laboratory hidden therein, where you’ll discover what Mary learned under the tutelage of the famous alchemist who called the place home, and how it inspired her to write what many call the first science fiction novel, Frankenstein.

updates.update_content:
Dearest Friends and Enemies,
Apologies for the longer-than-average delay between updates. I've been working hard getting our escape room, Lab Rat, back up and running (And if any of you haven't been yet, you should come play!), while Terry continues to work 90-hour weeks designing this here game you were all so lovely to support. So let's get to some news already!

updates.update_userinfo: Man, A Mother's Day Update to "Mother of Frankenstein" Would've Been Great...
updates.update_content:
Dearest Friends and Enemies,
Happy day-after-Mother's Day. Hope your mothers are doing well. Which kinda sounds like a giant collective Yo' Mama joke. Which I'm totally fine with.
FIRST OFF - A few folks don't seem to have seen our last update. Feel free to pop back to read it now, but the tl;dr of it all is: We're delayed. Game's coming October, or November at the worst. We're working with a super experienced games publisher, so our adjusted timeline is now much firmer, like a Tempurpedic mattress, or the rebuke of an elder.
So, given that there isn't any news on that front, we figured we'd share a bunch of new artwork. Terry has been working 60-hour weeks finalizing the insanely complex imagery that goes into the 3D puzzle. Basically, Frankenstein's castle and its environs have been fully modelled in 3D. Then, through Terry magic, 2D textures are constructed to best simulate what it would "feel" like to be looking at this 3D castle from various angles, which are then applied to the facades. It sounds complicated, and is much more complicated than it sounds. (DO NOT get Terry started on "bleed". Trust me.)

updates.update_userinfo: New Designs! & A New Kickstarter from Our Partners on Mother of Frankenstein!
updates.update_content:
So why radically reimagine just ONE piece of Gothic literature when you can do them ALL?
  We're delighted to let you know about GRAY, from Arvind Ethan David, our partner on Mother of Frankenstein. Here's what I said about this when I first read it:

"Gray is the re-imagining of Oscar Wilde's classic tale I didn't know I needed, updating its themes for the modern era without losing any of the caustic wit or commentary that made the novel infamous in the first place..." -Me (Tommy Wallach) Co-Creator of Mother of Frankenstein & NYTimes Best-Selling Author

updates.update_userinfo: Just Don't Call Me Tom(my) DeLay
updates.update_content:
Dearest Friends and Enemies,
Happiest of Fridays to you all. I arrive today with some unfortunate news...with a silver lining. As has already been discussed in comments on previous updates, the realities of COVID manufacturing have caught up with us in a fairly significant way. While we've known we were delayed for a while now, we've been holding up on providing an update until we had a clearer idea of just how long it will be until we can deliver Mother of Frankenstein. We now have a clear-ish idea, so we're coming to you.

updates.update_userinfo: Three Volumes: One Game + A Free Puzzle Draft!
updates.update_content:
Dearest Friends and Enemies,
Happiest of Marches to you all.  Not too much to report at the moment, but wanted to let you know we are all alive and well and working away like the busiest of bees.  A few small updates:
1) Unfortunately, our biggest piece of news is not quite shareable yet, so you'll just have to keep holding out for it. However, I can tell you about one interesting related development: we are now planning to sell as This was a request from a lot of brick and mortar shops for whom the $120 MSRP was a little steep as the only available option. Instead, we expect the three volumes to cost around $40 a piece. To be clear, this will not affect Kickstarter in any way. All you lovely folks will be getting all three volumes at once and early, as promised. But it's still kinda cool.

Dearest Friends and Enemies,
We swore to ourselves we would be more open and communicative in this New Year. Thus, here we are again.
At the moment, we're finalizing the gameplay for Volume Two so that we can begin playtesting Volume One and Two together. We've come up with a pretty smashing finale for Volume Two that we're extremely excited about...but we're not about to give it away. A hint? Well let's just say you'll be doing things with a jigsaw puzzle you've never done before. (That sounds racy.)

Dearest Friends and Enemies,
This sure has been an exciting two weeks, hasn't it? Oof.
Well, whatever else is happening in the world, know that we here at Hatch are still making great strides and leaps and bounds as we continue to work to get Mother of Frankenstein to you as quickly as possible. We have some big news that we're not quiiiiiite ready to deliver just yet, so this update will be more about the cool work we're doing. Please do let us know in the comments what else you'd like to see/hear in these updates, and we'll strive to meet your demands!

Risks and challenges
Risks and Challenges
 
Although this is the first campaign for Glass Cannon Unplugged, we have been working in teams that fulfilled 7 campaigns (games done by Phalanx and This War Of Mine: The Board Game) and manufactured and distributed more than 20 titles. We do not expect delays in production, but unforeseen issues may arise during manufacturing and shipping. We estimate that in the worst-case scenario, the production might suffer delays of at most 30-60 days, and shipping & customs may add an extra 15-45 days. We are experienced with large production runs, and we are preparing back-up plans for each step of the project, from production to shipping and final delivery. We will be working with trusted partners for manufacturing and logistics, their names will be revealed upon campaign launch.
 
By backing this project you agree that our primary responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into the pledge management system. You are responsible for import or other duties that may be payable to relevant tax authorities. You also accept that you are fully liable for incorrect shipping details and will risk your pledge being undeliverable or lost in transit. We are unable to ship to PO Boxes. We allow a maximum of one delivery location per backer, regardless of the number of pledges/copies ordered.
 
Please note that geopolitical events not under our control, such as Brexit and the imposition of new tariffs on the access of goods to a country, may change the terms we offer to residents of such countries, even if we guarantee we will do our best to avoid such issues.
 
COVID-19 has been a challenge for us all, we observe the global situation and think ahead, to minimize risk we have decided to work with companies that have a stable position on the market and to the best of our knowledge will not endanger the production and fulfillment of this project.
 
Since the start of the pandemic, we have been working remotely and plan to do so until it is once again safe to meet in the workplace. Using project management tools and Tabletop Simulator we are able to not only run the tests locally how we would in a normal situation but engage internationally with interested testers, this has been very beneficial to the project.

If you apply for a refund after the end of the Kickstarter then we will be able to refund 85% of your pledge. The difference is the amount of the unrecoverable fees paid to process your order.
Once we have started to pack your order, refunds won't be possible.
Refunds are reversed via Stripe to the credit card you used to pledge originally. This project is being funded in EUR and any refunds processed will also be in EUR.
 
If you do not accept the proposed terms, then please do not back this project; kindly wait for the retail release.

updates.update_content:
Hello Frostlanders,
Today’s update is sponsored by the letter U, like the word unexpected 😊, dad’s jokes aside this update is ahead of schedule by 2 weeks! It is mainly because we’d like to place the game’s manual in your hands as soon as possible. This is a crucial step in the grand scheme of things, and we didn’t want to wait for the regular, monthly update to do so.
The text of the manual is ready. It is not digitally prepared yet, nor is it after the final proofreading since it will happen once your – community proofreading happens 😊. We’d like to ask all of you who feel the need and possess the time and skill to do so to read through the text looking for potential language slips and mistakes but also to provide us feedback if the rules as written are clear, accessible and leave little to no room for doubts.

Hello Frostlanders,
We hope that the spring has melted the snow and ice where you live (hopefully not on the South Pole…) and that you take your time to appreciate the sunshine and the blossoming nature. May is particularly beautiful here in Poland with lush, green trees and people smiling more often as the country is slowly coming back to life after the worst waves of the pandemic. Kids are back at school (thus our efficiency is a bit higher 😉) and things are looking good, and we look to the future with a shy smile of optimism.

Hello Frostlanders!
Today’s update will feature the updated Tabletop Simulator module as well as revised rules – just as mentioned in our last communication. We do hope that the changes we introduced will be to your liking – we are extremely excited about it! Please give a big shout out to Adam and to our dev team (Rafał, Grzesiek, Bartek and Paweł) thanks to whom Frostpunk: The Board Game is an even better game than before! The most essential changes were described in the last update so if you missed it we highly recommend acquainting yourself with it (it’s not short but it is packed to the brim with important information!), oh and don’t forget to come back to this update once you’re done reading 😉.

updates.update_userinfo: Pledge Manager - new products & last call to fill out the survey! / Delay / Changes in the game
updates.update_content:
Hello Frostlanders!
We are grateful for your participation in filling the survey posted in our previous update. More than 3000 backers filled the survey. A bit over 2000 of you declared the demand for the hold-it-all box and a bit over a 1000 said they will be getting the wooden meeples depicting buildings. Due to the number of answers and your feedback we’ve just added both add-ons to the pledge manager and you can now add them to your baskets if you will. Both add-ons are also available for the late pledgers.

Hello Frostlanders!
DISCLAIMER: If you are not interested in the alternative wooden game components nor the big-hold-it all-box please ignore this update. Our regular update is coming and will be posted in the first half of April. The April update will feature a detailed development & production schedules and a lot “what’s new” information. If you are curious about the potential new addons please keep on reading :-) !

updates.update_userinfo: Snow is thawing, the Spring is coming!
updates.update_content:
Greetings and salutations dear Frostlanders!
We hope that wherever it is that you call home you too can feel the coming of the Spring. In Poland we had a rather oldschool Polish winter with snow and temperatures of – 10 Celsius at night so it caused some everyday life issues and a ton of fun for the kids 😊. Surrounded by frosty weather, covered in snow and unable to leave (pandemic restrictions) we kind of felt trapped, as if in some crater with walls frozen solid…

updates.update_userinfo: Hear me, hear me! Pledge Manager is Live! Pre-Order is Live!
updates.update_content:
Hello Frostlanders!
We’ve said our goodbyes to 2020, although for us it had one major positive memory - it saw the birth of Frostpunk: The Board Game and this year will be all about seeing it land safely on your tables and stay there for many months, if not years to come! We are doing everything we can to deliver a game you’ve dreamt of. Happy New Year!
The Pledge Manager

Hello Frostlanders!
We decided to publish this, second after the campaign update, a bit sooner mainly because we wanted to pass our wishes to all of you beautiful souls! To those of you who partake in the Christmas tradition we wish the merriest possible time with your loved ones and to those of you who have other beliefs or simply don’t have any we hope that the upcoming year brings only the most welcome changes and improves every aspect of your lives. We hope that no matter where you are in World these last days of 2020 will allow you to catch a breath and gain the strength needed to face what 2021 has in store for us ;-). With a new hope we all look to 2021 to bring us challenges that we can easily overcome together without any bad outcomes, so let’s hope that the Event card to be drawn on the 1st of January will be a good and easy one ;-). To wrap it up we wish you all the strength and determination to turn the upcoming year into a series of success and joyful memories!

Hello Frostlanders!
We hope you missed us a bit, cause sure as heck we missed y’all!
Preparing and managing a Kickstarter campaign, let me tell you, It’s like being on a roller coaster. First the slow build-up, then it goes live, excitement and adrenaline courses through your veins, and before you know it, it’s over. All those pent up emotions have to find an outlet and be refocused elsewhere: towards fulfillment. And let me tell you, we haven’t wasted any of those short autumn days.
Work Report

campaign.story:
I created SkullCrows as a way to celebrate my favorite holiday (Halloween, duh!) all year long. I have only ever been able to produce a few of these sculptures at a time, so I have rallied up a small team that is going to help me produce these guys on a large scale quickly to get them to their new homes all across the US just in time for October! We are passionate about the amount of detail in our products and could not be more excited to bring you your very own SkullCrow to haunt your home for years to come!
Exclusive design by Jamison Akers that will be printed on stickers, buttons, totes, shirts, posters, and more!

Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
All of our sculptures contain real wood, and all pieces are sealed to protect it as long as possible. Since these guys do not have articulation, the likelihood of wear and tear is very minimal.
Reusability and recyclability
We have a zero waste policy when it comes to producing our SkullCrows. Anything not used in production (which is usually nothing), is taken to a local recycling facility.
Sustainable materials
We only ship in environmentally safe boxes and paper packing materials. No plastic packaging will be used in the shipment of our SkullCrows.

campaign.story:
PLAY







Traditional pitchers collect unwanted pollutants in filters where they can quickly multiply and reverse contaminate your water. 
The LARQ Pitcher goes beyond filtration with a unique 2-step filtration and purification process for pure-tasting water sip after sip.


Traditional filters simply trap and collect unwanted pollutants where they can quickly accumulate and multiply. By removing chlorine, the filters become the perfect breeding ground for bacteria, mold, and other pollutants in just 2 weeks—making the filter itself a source of contamination.
Read about it in our white paper




Go beyond filtration with two-step filtration and purification.

Step 1: Better filtration
Our carbon-derived, plant-based filter gets rid of unwanted contaminants like lead, mercury, chlorine, VOCs, and more, leaving you with pure, crisp-tasting water. No compromises here.


Step 2: PureVis™ purification technology
What traditional water pitchers are missing is a vital second step—PureVis™ UV-C purification, which eradicates bio-contaminants at the molecular level. Keeping your water as pure as nature intended.






Name a water pitcher with better features, we'll wait.
No other pitcher gives you the seamless experience and uncompromising innovation that the LARQ Pitcher offers.




Something you used to hide away just became the main attraction.
Available in 2 rich colors that stand the test of time.


Step 1: Fill up your LARQ Pitcher
Step 2: Tap the button to start purifying as it filters
Step 3: Sip and enjoy. Ah, that’s what we call pure water beyond filtration. 



We've done the science to help you drink brilliantly.
LARQ's proprietary and patented PureVis™ UV-C LED technology is the most advanced in the world.


We opted out of the hard outer plastic casing you’ll find with traditional filters and created a more sustainable woven material to help provide structure to the filter media. The result? A 75% reduction in plastic use during filter replacements over the course of a year.
By flattening the filter geometry we were able to maximize surface area for the perfect balance between efficacy, filter speed, and lifetime.


Two types of filters to choose from based on your water quality needs.
LARQ Filters will be tested to NSF standards (42 and 53) to achieve >90% reduction across a range of contaminants.
All rewards or add-ons with Advanced Filter will ship in Q1 2021.







We’re taking the next two months to finalize our certifications. Here’s a look at our preliminary third-party testing across a range of contaminants.
Certifications that we'll get before we ship




Your personal control center (coming Q2 2021)
LARQ App Overview



Who said practical had to be boring?
Household essential turned table centerpiece. We can dig it. Our unique 2-step filtration and purification process leave you with perfectly crisp drinking water—which means better coffee, better tea, better cooking, and better hydration. 



This isn’t our first rodeo. 
With thousands of reviews, ratings, press features, and even awards for the LARQ Bottle and LARQ Bottle Movement, delivering quality products that work is what we do.


The LARQ Pitcher is the first of a whole new class of pitchers with advanced technology that delivers the purest water, but you can see that for yourself.




Rewards or add-ons with Advanced filter will ship at a later date (Q1 2021)

We are LARQ.
LARQ began with a simple vision where innovative technology can be combined with inspirational design to help people access pristine drinking water easily and sustainably.
Our products look as good as they make you feel. We are confident that these are the most beautiful hydration products in the world that make it easier for you to make the healthier and sustainable choice, anytime and anywhere.
You are what you drink. So #DrinkBrilliantly.

We want to assure our backers that we’ve partnered with world-class logistic solution providers to ensure the delivery of all of our rewards across the world.
Please be aware that all shipping, sales and VAT taxes will be collected after the campaign is over. 
Shortly before the LARQ Pitcher ships, we will email you a link so you can:

Pay shipping and sales/VAT/GST tax
Order additional filters, the LARQ Pitcher or other accessories

Taxes will vary based on where your rewards are shipped. For the following countries, we're collecting taxes before shipping, so you won’t have to worry about paying them at the time of delivery, extra fees, or being held up in customs.

This will help ensure that every backer receives their LARQ Reward on time based on the reward selected. This will not change existing rewards, however, we would recommend checking any existing pledges under your “Backed Projects”  to confirm your reward’s estimated shipping window.  Please note that the shipping start date is based on the perk you backed. Due to shipping logistics, not all perks will ship at once. We anticipate it will take ~2 months from the start of each estimated shipping window listed below to fulfill all orders globally.
We hope by spreading out the shipping start dates for the new rewards, we can ensure that rewards are shipped out right on schedule. As always if you have any questions, please reach out to our team at hello@livelarq.com and we would be happy to help.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We took on the challenge of introducing PureVis™, our patented UV-C technology with the LARQ Bottle back in November 2017 on Kickstarter. We are continuing that tradition of innovation with our new filter technology. 

We learned that existing filter technology hasn’t changed much since the introduction of countertop filters in the 1960s. Activated carbon wrapped around a hard plastic filter housing. The most popular models on the market today do little more than remove chlorine and reduce a small handful of contaminants - a cosmetic treatment. Other heavy-duty filters will literally filter out everything from the water, including beneficial minerals and would clog in as little as 2 weeks making them impractical, wasteful and frustrating. 

We wanted to rethink the filter from the ground up, starting with first principles. The foundation of our filter had to be a sustainable material - so we chose a plant-based sustainable carbon. This was a fundamental challenge in finding the right filter design was balancing filtering efficacy, with lifetime and filter speed. We knew we had to find the goldilocks zone of efficacy, sustainability and practicality. This turned out to be no simple task. But with the hard work and dedication from our engineering team, we redesigned the filter geometry and we were able to maximize surface area for the perfect balance between efficacy, filter speed and lifetime. 

We’re taking the next two months to fine-tune our filters and already have preliminary third-party lab results to share. We'll continue testing and provide updates to you. 

We have already begun the manufacturing and production process based on the current design of the Pitcher. With your support, we can quickly scale and expedite the manufacturing and production process so that we can get the LARQ Pitcher into the hands of thousands, and you can be proud to know that you made it happen. While we have budgeted sufficient resources and time, we know that there might be things outside of our control and current visibility. Our timeline as planned:

- The LARQ Pitcher with Essential LARQ Filter(s) will begin shipping in December 2020
- The LARQ Pitcher with Advanced LARQ Filter(s) and/or any rewards with Advanced LARQ Filter as an add-on will begin shipping in Q1 2021

We don't anticipate any issues currently with this timeline. However, if by chance anything unexpected happens, we promise to keep you informed, both during the campaign and afterward.

campaign.story:
Update on VAT & Sales Taxes
We've spoken to 3 international region-friendly VAT/tax experts, and guess what? It's complicated, confusing, and all about to change in 2021 when our game ships and the tax assessments need to be made. Loopholes are closing, regulations are tightening, previous tax-minimization schemes are disappearing, but we can say we're happy to help out as much as possible. Here's how:
We will pay for any VAT / tax fees on any shipping charges. Backers will only pay required sales/VAT taxes for their Core or Deluxe game purchases (and any add-ons). This avoids the dreaded double-tax stack-up that many backers face when including shipping charges into the tax equation.
Retailers in the UK/EU: you may have to pay VAT on your 6-pack bundle, but this is a recoverable expense, and will also depend on whether your store and our chosen distribution partner's warehouse are located in the same country. We should have better information on that when the pledge manager opens and once our final EU/UK distribution partner is selected.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our team of creative professionals has combined decades of experience in developing products for mass production. Even though this may be our first tabletop game, we're being advised by some of the top leaders in the industry who have helped guide our every step. Of course, we're also using top-tier manufacturing and fulfillment partners. 

That said, we live in a dynamic world which is currently being tested like never before. Changes in manufacturing partners, paper costs, shipping fluctuations, global economics: all can affect our final outcome and schedule. But be confident that all issues that may arise during our development process, from schedule delays to component quality, will be quickly and clearly shared with our backers via frequent updates. We're in this together now!

DISCLAIMER: as we continue to develop the game for mass-production, the artwork, components, names, and likenesses shown in the above illustrations are subject to change.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
By having a highly expandable and upgrade-able game system, The Shivers will always be new and evolving. The game has an intrinsic quality that will last through generations, not a quick fad that gets played a couple times then sits on a shelf (or worse, goes into the trash).
Sustainable materials
Our paper pop-up constructions and manuals will use FSC-type paper certified by FSC (Forest Stewardship Council), which ensures proper sustainable forest management is used to harvest trees for paper.
Environmentally friendly factories
Our pop-up manufacturing factory is accredited by FSC.org to ensure sustainable forestry and conservation practices to support their paper supply chain.
Something else
Our unique Story Card system of creating new episodes allows for players to print episodes on their own home printers (this functionality will be enabled on future expansions). This means no burden to supply chain or environmental impact from international shipping, as printing of new episodes will be on-demand, local, and with much less environmental impact.

campaign.story:
The Hell House is a physical VHS case with art by Bryan Fyffe that imagines a fictional film from 1983. While there is no real Hell House film, and no real VHS tape, inside the VHS case you will find art prints, a letter, and a small physical art object. These interior components will connect you to the story of the imaginary film, and to the history surrounding it. The Hell House is a limited edition Kickstarter-exclusive collectible, signed and numbered by Bryan Fyffe, and unavailable for purchase anywhere else.
Open the VHS case, and inside you will find a treasure trove of art components!
Tier Four Stretch Goal Unlocked! Every backer will be randomly entered into a lottery, and one backer will be chosen to receive the RED KEY, granting a FREE top tier reward in the upcoming Fall 2020 Shadow of Cthulhu Kickstarter.
We are overjoyed with your support. We have one final stretch goal for the last day of the HELL HOUSE kickstarter, and this one is special and a bit different. Every backer will be entered into a lottery, and one lucky backer will be randomly selected. The winner will receive a RED KEY. This is a one of a kind key, included in your Hell House case. While we don't know for sure if the red key unlocks La Rovina Rossa, the ruinous red room at the heart of the imaginary HELL HOUSE, we do know that in real life it unlocks for the winner a FREE top-tier reward for the upcoming Shadow of Cthulhu Fall 2020 Kickstarter!
Unlocked! Each backer will be placed in a lottery and one lucky backer will receive a red key unlocking a free top tier in the upcoming fall 2020 Shadow of Cthulhu Kickstarter!
Here are the details:
As soon as the HELL HOUSE Kickstarter finishes, Bryan will literally and physically put all backers names in a big halloween skull bowl!
Bryan will draw one lucky winner from the bowl and put the red key in that winner's HELL HOUSE case!
Bryan will mail all HELL HOUSE cases, art prints, and canvas prints to all backers!
We won't announce the winner right away so that you can open your case and possibly find a red key!
Contact Bryan if you received the red key and feel free to share on social media!
The winner will then receive, for free, a full collection of the top-tier of The Shadow of Cthulhu Kickstarter when it ships! No purchase or shipping necessary!
Disclaimer: Bryan and Sebastian are not responsible for what happens if anyone actually uses the RED KEY to open any real doors.
Tier Three Stretch Goal Unlocked! Every backer will receive a Cthulhu mini-print that teases the Shadow of Cthulhu, and upcoming Fall 2020 Kickstarter project coming soon.
What is the Shadow of Cthulhu? You will find out more in coming months, but to tease a bigger upcoming Fall 2020 Kickstarter project, every backer will receive one of these Shadow of Cthulhu mini art prints. 
Note: This print is original, and is only available as part of the HELL HOUSE. 
Cthulhu mini-print unlocked. Every backer gets one!
So many delightful, tiny, and ominous little Cthulhus!
Each and every backer will receive a Shadow of Cthulhu mini art print if the HELL HOUSE reaches $4500 in funding!

Tier Two Stretch Goal Unlocked! Every backer will receive a printed appendix that details the story behind the HELL HOUSE.
Because of your support we met our second stretch goal. HELL HOUSE passed $3,500 in funding, and each and every HELL HOUSE VHS case will now come with a front-back printed sheet that details the history behind the HELL HOUSE. The Appendix is available below in the Kickstarter website, but this printed and aged version will fit neatly in the case and live alongside the art elements so that you can turn out the lights and experience the full HELL HOUSE by candle-light!
Each and every backer now gets a printed appendix!
Each and every backer will receive a printed copy of the story behind the HELL HOUSE
Tier One Stretch Goal UNLOCKED! Every backer now gets a Memento Mori 4x3 mini-print
Bryan has created a lovely little 4 x 3 inch memento mori  art print, and it will now be included in every backer's package. A memento mori, (Latin for "remember you must die"), is an artwork designed to remind the viewer of their mortality and of the shortness and fragility of human life. Death comes for us all, and when you step inside the HELL HOUSE, you can feel its weight, it's burden, and its inescapable inevitability.
Death may be inevitable, but now so is this wonderful mini-print.
UNLOCKED!
4 x 3 mini art print available to all backers now that we have crossed the $2500 funding threshold!
We love old VHS movie cases. We still own many of our favorite classic VHS films, and we cherish them as collectibles. There was something magical about the artwork of 1980s VHS cases. Bryan and Sebastian would wander past the midwest rental shelves at our local gas stations, lured in by gloriously rendered plastic rectangles of art that captured a whole film with a single mysterious image. The best art would make you pick up the case, flip to the back, and if you were lucky, find a story that connected to the art—a story you couldn't wait to see unfold at home on your cathode ray golden-ratio 4:3 television. 
This is the story we imagined for the Hell House:
 1983 Color Stereo approx 90 mins
1669. Christoph Haizmann binds his soul to the devil. Bondage written in blood. Haizmann produced 100s of demonic paintings, some lost to time.
1923. Sigmund Freud evaluates the painter as suffering from demonical neurosis.
1937. Adolf Hitler reads Freud's essay, acquires Haizmann's works, and displays them in public at the Degenerate Art Exhibition. A framed Haizmann cannot be photographed; the framed art is obscured by shadow in every photo ever taken.
1982. Fredrick Haizmann (Christopher Lee) is an occult art dealer with a secret key to a secret room. What cannot be captured, can only be seen in person, deep with the Rovina Rossa. He lures a clandestine group of collectors, including Arthur Grimvane (Vincent Price), to his family home where he reveals the lost demonic paintings of his ancient relative, Christoph Haizmann.
When the lights go out, and the paintings come to life, whether real or illusion, the collectors find themselves locked within the very heart of the…THE HELL HOUSE!



Reward Tiers
There are 3 different pledge-level reward tiers. All of them contain the VHS case and included art components, but you can also combine the VHS with either a large poster or a custom framed canvas. All VHS cases, prints, and canvases will be signed and numbered by Bryan Fyffe.
Note: US shipping and handling is included in the cost of each tier. International shipping is not supported.
Tier 1: $35 dollars (includes shipping) gets you the Hell House VHS case signed and numbered with all the collectibles inside
Tier 2 - The Art Buyer: $65 Dollars gets you a high-quality art print (13 x 19) signed and numbered and the Hell House VHS case signed and numbered with all the collectibles inside,
Tier 3 - The Haunted Frame: $325 dollars gets you a hand-crafted framed canvas (16 x 20) signed and numbered, and the Hell House VHS case signed and numbered and all the collectibles inside
Shipping and Handling
The cost of your pledge covers shipping and handling in the United States. 
Note: International shipping and handling is not supported at this time

The story for the imaginary film The Hell House was inspired by several real life historical events. Seriously!
1660-1700
The blood-bond, possession, and exorcism of Christoph Haizmann
The Sacred Trophaeum Mariano-Cellense, (The Trophy of Mariazell), lives in the Austrian National Library in Vienna, The Fideikommissbibliothek. The Trophaeum, which was rigorously studied by Sigmund Freud, details the painter Christoph Haizmann’s struggle with demonic possession. Haizmann describes the death of his father, loss of faith in God, and describes signing not one, but two pacts with the devil. The first, written in ink, was not enough; in 1669 he signed a second copy, one that was bound by his own blood.   
The original demonic bond signed by Christoph Haizmann. Source: Trophaeum Mariano-Cellense
The contract is unique in ways even Freud recognized: Haizmann wanted nothing in return. He did not ask the devil for wealth, money, or power in the typical Faustian model. Haizmann was contracted for nine years, and in the Trophaeum describes in grave detail how the devil appeared to him in visions, often as a red dragon-creature with breasts and sharp talons. He also had visions of hell, which he described as “filled with burning flames and terrible stench. In it there was a large cauldron from which came heart-rending moans and groans of human beings; on its edge sat a hellish devil who did nothing but pour flaming resin, sulphur and pitch over them.”   
Unframed Haizmann artwork, including the tryptich included in the Trophaeum
Multiple exorcisms were performed on Haizmann. The Trophaeum quotes both Haizmann and his exorcists in detail. “When I went to confess, the priest ordered me to say the confession-prayer. But I could not pray it although I started four times” Four devils assailed him. “One of them sat on my tongue so I took my hand and tore out the evil spirit.” Haizmann’s exorcist described a great winged dragon returning the blood-bonded manuscript to Haizmann during the exorcism; “O foolish cunning of the Evil One! In the form of a dragon he appeared in the sanctuary.” After hours of exorcism, Haizmann was temporarily redeemed via the mirable dictu. Later in life his pain returned, and he began to fall victim to horrifying attacks on his mind and body, resulting in “trances, visions, and convulsions so violent that on one occasion he writhed about until blood gushed from his nose and mouth”. 

 1920-1938 
The study of demonological illness, and the Lost Appendix of Sigmund Freud
In 1922, Dr. Rudolf Payer-Thurn, director of the Austrian National Library in Vienna, discovered the Trophaeum Mariano-Cellense. He sought out Sigmund Freud’s expertise. Freud was the first to study the Trophaeum, and had long been interested in the power of witchcraft, possession, and how neuroses were represented in the ancient world. Writing to a friend he stated:
“What have you got to say to the suggestion that the whole of my brand-new theory of the primary origins of hysteria is already familiar and has been published a hundred times over, though centuries ago? Do you remember my always saying that the medieval theory of possession, that held by the ecclesiastical courts, was identical to our theory of a foreign body and the splitting of consciousness?” 
Sigmund Freud studying the Trophaeum
Freud was confident there was evidence of neurosis in sacred or precious remains of the past, and saw symptoms of hysteria in “the portrayals of possession and ecstasy that have been preserved for us in the productions of art”. Freud asked, what if the past captured moments of neurotic illness, like an ancient plague frozen in the ice of an artist’s despair expressed in ink or paint, waiting to be thawed out, waiting to poison minds across the void of time? The psychic maladies of times past are recorded and preserved in the works of art, transmitting the psychic horrors, often misunderstood, into posterity.
After studying the Trophaeum, he published “Eine Teufelsneurose im Siebzehnten Jahrhundert” (A Seventeenth-Century Demonological Neurosis)” in 1923.  Freud found Haizmann’s case to be one where Haizmann believed what he was saying was true. Freud expresses Haizmann’s loss of his father as creating severe depression and mental illness which Haizmann solved by inventing a new father: Satan. Freud believed God and Satan were both types of father figures, and Haizmann, seeking to fill a dark void, believed God took his father away, so he gained a new father in the devil. 
Later revisions of Freud’s essay contain the following note from 1938, one year before his death, in an appendix:
“I have been gifted a painting believed to have been ensorcelled by Haizmann’s demonic pact. I revisited the Trophaeum, and discovered in my original reading I translated “notitiis clausura redundat” as the enclosure where Haizmann’s exorcism took place, the void where exorcism worked like an ancient psychoanalysis to appease the demonological illness. Yet now as I hold this painting, the corrupted neurosis of the tortured artist overwhelms me. I smell searing flesh, like a spit pig cooking over a roaring fire, captured impossibly in the wood-grain of the ancient frame. “notitiis clausura redundat” could also mean the enclosure of the painting. I can no longer bear to look upon this work, and my hands sting where I touched the painting’s black frame.”
                                       ~Freud
Freud revisits his original essay on Haizmann after obtaining a framed copy of Haizmann's work

 1906-1938 
Adolf Hitler's demonological connection to Haizmann
It is possible Hitler was touched by Haizmann's work at a young age.  August Kubizek, one of Hitler's closest friends since childhood, claims that Hitler at age 17, once spoke to him of "returning Germany to its former glory". August stated: "It was as if another being spoke out of his body, and moved him as much as it did me".
The first photographic evidence of the inability to capture framed Haizmann artworks can be found as early as a 1918 in Italy. Hitler may have been aware of Haizmann, and obsessed with seeing the un-photographable art even in his twenties.
First historical photograph of a framed Haizmann, which is obscured by shadow
In Hitler's own forgotten library, just around the time he would have read Freud's essay on Haizmann, he underlined a passage in his 1923 copy of Magic: History, Theory and Practice, (which is dedicated to Hitler). "He who does not have the demonic seed within himself will never give birth to a magical world". In the same year, Hitler's mentor, Dietrich Eckhart, wrote: "Follow Hitler! He will dance, but it is I who have called the tune. We have given him the 'means of communication' with Them".
Hitler, obsessed with both deviant art and Austrian culture, discovers the Haizmann estate, and hunts down as many of the lost paintings as he can find. His hunt leads him to a strange estate in Italy run by a nearly-blind Austrian woman, Annelise Elsa Fleischmann. It is unknown what caused Annie's eyes to ghost over with a milky-white film.
The only surviving photograph of Annelise Elsa Fleischman, caretaker of the Haizmann estate
Fleischmann was the sole caretaker of a manor full of occult paintings, most of which were Haizmann's, or which Hitler believed were the lost Haizmann paintings. In 1937 he displayed some of Haizmann's art at the Enarte Kunst, the Degenerate Art Exhibit. Images that could be seen in person, are inexplicably blackened out in every developed photograph. 
Hitler is believed to have displayed Haizmann's art at the Degenerate Art Exhibit in 1937
In 1938, Hitler annexed Austria itself, and during The Anschluss, Hitler read the original Trophaeum Mariano-Cellense in Vienna. At this time Hitler also identified Annie Fleischmann as a Jew, and after annexing Austria, moved her from Italy to Austria, where she was imprisoned in the Mauthausen, Vienna's category III concentration camp, and home of the "Stairway of Death".  
The SS called Mauthausen Knochenmühle, or the bone grinder, AKA The Stairs of Death

Post-War
The recovery of the Haizmann estate and the lost key
At the end of the war, the allies recovered most of Haizmann's art, along with thousands of other lost masterpieces. Some of Haizmann's works, which could not be photographed, were warehoused and kept by the Allies for study.  
Allied soldiers recover framed Haizmann art from a Nazi cache. The Haizmann is again obscured in shadow.
Incredibly, Annie Fleischmann survived Mauthausen, and returned with much of the Haizmann estate intact to the mansion in Italy. Before she died, she sent a letter to the last living heir of the Haizmann estate.
Fredrick Haizmann received Annie Fleischmann's letter and became obsessed with unravelling the history of Christoph Haizmann and his estate.  Fredrick claims ownership of the estate. He finds a mysterious, locked door in the central parlor of the mansion. 
The entire mansion that holds Haizmann's lost work is built around a locked room with no key. This room is believed to be la Rovina Rossa
The door, which reads Rovina Rossa, was impenetrable.  No key fit the shape of the lock. The room was missing from the architectural blueprints of the mansion. A shroud settled across his mind. Uncast shadows danced across the paintings his great ancestor created centuries ago. A solitary unmarked grave lied under a withering olive tree. He looked again at the letter Annie sent him, and read the final lines aloud: "Niemand kann ins herz schauen". No one can look into the heart. Fredrick knew then what he must do to recover the key, and unlock the door. He would do anything to look within the dark heart of the Hell House.  
The solitary grave of Annelise Elsa Fleischmann


New to Kickstarter? 
If you're not familiar with Kickstarter, it’s a platform that allows creators to crowdfund their creative projects. The campaign lasts several weeks, and when it’s over, we will produce and fulfill your order. We will send out updates as the campaign progresses, and after it closes, and we will clearly communicate with you via email and the Kickstarter, ensuring you know when your package will arrive.
If you’d like to know more about how to make a pledge on Kickstarter, here's a short overview.

About the Creators
Bryan Fyffe
Bryan Fyffe creates physical art through digital light and composition, bringing together thousands of layers of vector components and photographic elements into a single, stunning composite. Bryan's art is featured at both Disneyland and Walt Disney World, and you can find him and his giant-sized hand-made found-framed canvas prints at the biggest conventions out there, from San Diego Comic-Con, to New York Comic Con, to the Atlanta Dragon Con.
Sebastian Fuhrer
Sebastian is an author, a content engineer, and an enthusiast. He enjoys learning from others, playing tabletop and video games, reading books, listening to music, and watching films that express experiences different from his own.  

FAQs
Can I pledge more than once? How do I purchase multiple copies? 
Unfortunately, Kickstarter limits your pledge to 1 per account. However, for our unlimited pledge tiers, if you want to purchase more than 1 copy, you can increase your pledge value to cover the cost, and message the creator: https://help.kickstarter.com/hc/en-us/articles/115005132333-Can-I-pledge-to-a-single-project-more-than-once-
For example, if you want two copies of the Hell House VHS case with artwork included inside, you can increase your pledge from 35 dollars to 70 dollars and contact Bryan to let him know exactly what you want with that $70. To contact Bryan, click on the creator's profile name. This will open up his bio page where you can then click the blue "Contact me" button to send him a message via Kickstarter.
Is the Hell House a real movie that I can find and watch?
We wish it were! The movie is an imagined film from an alternative history, and it does not exist in our time-stream.
What is VHS? 
VHS (Video Home System) was a standard for consumer-level analog video recording on tape cassettes. Home video rental during the 80s and 90s was primarily offered through VHS cassette tapes;  these tapes were offered in thick plastic cases which had artwork inserted into a transparent plastic film along the exterior of the case. 
Does the Hell House contain a copy of an actual VHS movie?
No.
What's inside the box?
Some fun objects, mostly printed pieces of art that accompany the backstory. If we told you, it would spoil the surprise, but there is nothing too crazy, unsafe, or overly costly to produce within.
Is this a limited-run collectors edition?
Yes. The Hell House  products are limited, and will only be available through this kickstarter.
Was Christoph Haizmann a real painter who Freud wrote about? 
Yes.
Did Christoph Haizmann really sign a contract with the devil?
Freud believed that the subject, Haizmann himself, believed he signed a contract.
Did Hitler read Freud's analysis?
The real historical time-line is perfect. While we can't prove Hitler read Freud's essay, the likelihood is high. However, it is worth noting how anathema Freud's psychoanalytic theories were to fascism and nazism. 
In 1907 Hitler and Freud actually lived in the same neighborhood. Hitler admired the Jewish artistic movement and longed to contribute to the arts and sciences. He was, however, rejected from Vienna's Academy of Fine Arts. By 1923 his views have changed dramatically, he publicly disapproves of Freud and declares psychoanalysis an idea of a deranged mind. 
Both Einstein and Freud are despised by the Nazi party for their anti-war rhetoric (note: a fascinating letter correspondence between Einstein and Freud is published). By 1938 when Hitler "liberates” Austria,  Freud's daughter Anna is captured up by Hitler's Gestapo. Upon her release Freud fled to London, but his sisters remained behind, and all of them died in concentration camps
Did Freud really write an appendix to his essay? 
No. This is the author's fictional creation. No Freuds were harmed in this twisted history, and none of Freud's original words were used in the creation of this appendix to his essay.
