campaign.story:
81 years ago, at the age of 77, Georges Méliès - the father of narrative and fantastical film - hand-wrote his autobiography; the story of the creation of cinema from not only a firsthand witness but also its greatest innovator. It has been completely unavailable since 1945 and has never been translated into English. This is one of the great unseen texts of cinema history.
I've had it translated. And it's GREAT! Reading it blew my film-loving mind. A voice from history telling me in his own words about how cinema began and his role in it. Now I need your help to rescue this important, illuminating and fascinating testimony, to get it back into print and where it truly belongs - in our hands and on our bookshelves.
GEORGES MÉLIÈS
Georges Méliès (1861-1938) is arguably the most important figure in narrative cinema history. He pioneered the Sci-fi, Fantasy and Horror genres, created special effects concepts which are still used today and gave the cinema its first iconic image - the moon with a rocket in his eye.
"[Méliès] discovered the means of placing poetry within the reach of the man in the street." - Walt Disney
"I owe him everything" - D.W. Griffith
"The alchemist of light" - Charlie Chaplin
"He invented everything, basically, he invented it all." - Martin Scorsese
In 1937, a year before he died, he wrote longhand a 32 page autobiography detailing his life, his work and his observations on both. He sent it to a film historian who was writing a book about him. The first 500 copies of this book were packaged with a facsimile of the manuscript. What remains of that print run exists now only in the jealously guarded collections of film enthusiasts who have been lucky or wealthy enough to secure one.
This memoir is an enthralling story in which Méliès guides us from his childhood into his early career, explaining how all of the elements fell into place to put him in the perfect position to become a pioneer of cinema. He talks about becoming one of the first people in the world to see a projected moving image at a private demonstration by the Lumiére brothers and the international mission this inspired him to take to become a part of the new medium. He explains how and why he became the first impressario of cinema, how he built France's first film studio and how he invented special effects techniques and helped define the very format of cinematic film. More than this, it's a human story; at times braggadocios, joyous, humble and bitter. We learn how times and the industry changed, how he became the first victim of film piracy and how he ended up in his old age, forgotten, broke and selling toys and sweets in a tiny stall in Montparnasse train station. Most interesting to me was discovering that he was a man already aware of his legacy and surprisingly unhappy about how he could see he was going to be remembered. His memoir crackles with life and is a vivid account of the dawn of movies from its most colourful participant.
73 years later, Méliès's autobiography is lost. Never translated into English, it is a footnote to a very rare book which has been out of print for over half of cinema's entire history. With your help, I want to put this incredible testimony back into print and create a beautiful first edition of it.
For the first time, Méliès's autobiography will be front and centre in a gorgeous hardback publication filled with supplementary material to create a definitive book to honour his work. The manuscript has been translated by a cine-literate translator, meaning the technical details Méliès refers to are soundly expressed.
This is a hugely important - and wonderfully characterful - piece of writing from a man who was present at the actual birth of cinema and single-handedly discovered, developed and created technical processes we still use to this day. Don't you want to have a copy of that?
This is a beautiful HARDBACK edition bound in BLACK CLOTH coverboards, with the cover art and spine hot-foil stamped to shimmer and sparkle. The front page will be hand-numbered and in the back of the book will be a list of all Kickstarter backers who brought this project to fruition.
THE KICKSTARTER BOOK
The book will contain:
- MÉLIÈS' UNABRIDGED AUTOBIOGRAPHY IN FULL, IN ENGLISH
- COMPREHENSIVE FOOTNOTE ANNOTATION, PROVIDING GREAT DEPTH AND FURTHER INSIGHT INTO HIS STORY.
- INTERVIEWS WITH FILM ACADEMICS AND FILMMAKERS ON MÉLIÈS' LEGACY AND INFLUENCE
- ILLUSTRATIONS AND PHOTOGRAPHS
- A GUIDE TO MÉLIÈS' FILMOGRAPHY
- TRANSCRIPTION OF MÉLIÈS' ORIGINAL MANUSCRIPT IN FRENCH
- SURPRISES.
Packaged in a bespoke wooden box sporting the logo of Méliès Star Film company, along with your book, you will receive:
- STRICTLY LIMITED TO 1896 NUMBERED COPIES WORLDWIDE.
This is a photo of me at 17 years old. If you look closely, you'll see the T-shirt I'm wearing is of Méliès's moon.
I don't remember exactly when I first discovered the work of Méliès, but I was familiar with, and adored his work by the time I was a teenager and hungered to see more than the famous 'A Trip To The Moon' and the occasional clips that would be shown in documentaries. However, I knew that most of his work was missing or unavailable.
There was plenty more cinema history to go around, though. My childhood, then teenage film obsession lead to film school and onto a career in and around film.
Whilst visiting Barcelona in 2013, I started noticing a lot of posters on the streets sporting Méliès's moon. My traveling companion told me they were advertising a Méliès exhibition. My jaw dropped and we turned on our heels, sprinting across town to the Caixa Forum. What I saw there blew my mind, I had no idea so much of Méliès's work survived - original artwork, sketches on the backs of dockets, original and incredible props and costumes from his films. I was in heaven. I learned that day that far more of his work survived and had been restored than I had previously realised. I bought an exhibition poster on my way out which has remained framed on my living room wall ever since.
I was now fully charged to find and watch as many of Méliès's films as I could and thanks to the wonderful DVD label Flicker Alley, I've been able to do just that. Méliès has remained a minor obsession of mine ever since.
Recently, I found my holy grail - the facsimile of his hand-written autobiography manuscript and I realised that it wasn't right that this document just languish in private collections. Méliès's thoughts deserve to be published and widely available.
Having delivered two successful film-based book campaigns on Kickstarter last year, I have the passion, the knowledge and the experience to do this but I need your support. Please back this project and/or let people know about it.

updates.update_content:
Hello Lovely Backers,
How are you? 
I know. Me too. Almost over, though, eh?
This'll brighten your day a bit - look at all of the new Méliès merch which has landed at  https://www.georgesmelies.co.uk/shop It's our WINTER COLLECTION!!!

Hello Lovely Backers, 
How are you? 
Me? I'm well, thank you! I'm considerably less stressed and exhausted from when you last heard from me. We hired a storage unit and have moved Operation Méliès across town, reclaiming our lives and house in the process. Apart from those of you affected by poor postage service, you all now have your books and boxes and I'm hoping very much that you're enjoying them. All of the posts on social media have been wonderful and have left me feeling so happy that I embarked on this crazy project.
Hello wonderful people,

The wooden boxes just arrived! Finally! Box sets are GO. Because they are two weeks later than the ‘they’ll definitely be with you by’ date, it makes things a bit tricky. This week we’re starting my daughter at nursery and my wife goes back to work AND I have a deadline on a job for 2 weeks time, so although we’ll be packing boxes in every spare minute, we have less spare minutes than the whole 2 weeks we’d put aside to do this.
We’ve decided that the most efficient way of doing this is to make up all of the box sets first, then package them up and post them. We have somewhere between 400 and 500 to do. So, it might take at least a couple of weeks to assemble them and then another week to get them all posted. With international mail being what it is right now, I have no idea about how long it’ll take to get to you but they are at least finally on the way! Please enjoy this photo of my living room...

Hi Backers,
So.... Ugh.
Here was the plan - and it was a great plan; The wooden boxes, which house the box sets were due to arrive at my tiny house on July 15th. I spent two weeks in early July preparing the things to go into the wooden boxes. I packed these into cardboard boxes which filled my under-stairs area. I ordered all of the packaging materials - many huge bags of inflatated protective wrap, protectove paper and, of course, cardboard boxes - all to ship over 400 box sets out in. These would all arrive the day before the wooden boxes, which coincided with the first day of my wife’s two-week summer holiday from work. My family would join us and, within 10 crazy, hard-workin’ days, we would have assembled, packaged and shipped out all 400 box sets. We would then clean the house and make it ours once more (remember we still have a couple of thousand copies of the book stacked in boxes in various places around the - did I mention TINY -  f*cking house? We woukd then ise the last few days to go away and celebrate my wife’s 40th birthday (1st August) in a covid-related-disappointingly-low-key manner  and then return to our tiny house and enjoy the space and relaxation of this period of Post-Méliès satisfaction. I say relaxation, she has to return to work and I have to finish the edit of my next feature film.

Hello Backers, 

In the attached photo, you will see some little strips of plastic. My life right now is little strips of plastic. They are the seal covers from the protective bags which I’m using to keep everything safe inside the box sets. They are very light and highly, highly charged with static - so they get everywhere and stick to everything.   Each box has two bags in it, meaning that currently I’m working up to 1000 of these plastic strips floating around the house.

Hello Backers!
Thought you might enjoy this... Your names are about to land on the shelves of the world’s most serious movie collectors.
Arrow Films have just announced the website exclusive box set version of their upcoming Méliès A Trip To The Moon Blu-Ray. I’ve contributed a new video essay to the disc and the collectors edition comes with a copy of our book! It’s limited to 1000 copies only and it’s the same version of the book that you have. So you’re all named in it.

The Neon Moon Tarot is a fully illustrated, 78-card tarot deck set in a retro-futuristic cyberpunk world using the archetypes and themes of a RWS tarot deck. Backers can expect a gritty urban hi-tech setting with a limited neon palette and heavy black inks. 
I've been able to work with different production sources to bring two different versions to this Kickstarter. The deck is available in both standard and pocket editions(details below).
Using the unique flexibility and depth of symbolism in the tarot, the Neon Moon deck emphasizes atmosphere and world-building. The RWS archetypes are alive and well here, merged with cyberpunk themes. 
The Neon Moon Tarot lives in its own unique world and does its best to bring you along. It asks you to use your gut to read meaning from the cards with intuition. But you aren't left out in the cold. Each card has associated keywords and quotes to get you started. If you'd like, you can  check them out right now at www.neonmoontarot.com
       The standard edition of The Neon Moon Tarot Deck measures 2.75 by 4.75 inches, and is printed on 300 GSM coated card stock. It comes complete with a custom rigid box and booklet. 
      The pocket edition of The Neon Moon Tarot measures 57 by 97 millimeters on 14 pt C2S coated card stock, and comes with a custom tuck box. 
Thanks to all of your support, we've hit the goal as of 2/17! Here are some extra goodies to look forward to as funding continues!
$6000 -UNLOCKED- Extra card unlocked! A second Fool card with a different take. Specific to this Kickstarter and won't be available in decks beyond Kickstarter backers. This reward will be automatically added on to both the pocket and standard editions of the deck, so if you've backed a tier with either you'll have an extra card for each deck.
$6500 -UNLOCKED- A short mini-comic in PDF format unlocks for all tiers! This comic will serve as an introduction to the Neon Moon's cyberpunk world. I'll be working on it myself in the same style that is present in the cards. 
$7000 -UNLOCKED- Pocket edition decks will now also include a booklet! Additionally, all backer tiers with physical product will receive a mini art-print of their choice(or random if the backer survey isn't filled out) from the deck with their package. Mini so I can fit it in without increasing weight or shipping costs.
$8500 -UNLOCKED- The short mini-comic PDF for all tiers from reward tier $6500 becomes a full length single issue comic(~30 pages) PDF for all tiers!
$10,000 -UNLOCKED- Along with your physical decks you will receive a letterpress printed prototype card of the next deck I’m working on. Additionally, we will unlock the Neon Moon Tarot Spread to the public. On top of that, the Neon Moon Card Game will also unlock for the public. Both will be posted to the Neon Moon website.
  The Neon Moon setting is my original take on a cyberpunk world. You'll see the usual themes of hi-tech low-life, A.I., cyborgs, corporations run amok, and more. For my version of the world, there is a divisive plate separating the rich and powerful from the masses underneath. 
The suit names have changed, along with the court cards, to better reflect the cyberpunk interpretation of this deck. They are as follows: 
Swords - Arms
Wands - Wires
Cups - Vials
Pentacles - Zent
Page - Apprentice
Knight - Agent
Queen - Supervisor
King - Executive
Above the plate, people can live essentially forever through a mixture of memory backups, clones, and "gene-therapy", which has resulted in a very strict society under constant surveillance by the most powerful members who have been alive for hundreds of years and in that time have accumulated power and wealth. The court cards effectively play the roles of those most powerful members of this society living on top of the world. 
For the minor pips, they depict life beneath the plate. I've strayed a bit from convention and things are more of a neon-lit, urban mad max than they are Neo-Tokyo. People are mostly too poor to advertise to, so most of the advertisements are aimed at pure necessities. Gangs roam what's left of the streets, sponsored militias run through on orders from above the plate, poverty is rampant and conflict is everywhere. People live short and violent lives of desperate struggle, and find hope and strength through banding together with friends. 
Outdated robots, discarded from above, hack into each others' firmware with updates giving their A.I. freedom. Gene-therapy is largely experimental and therefore much less stable than above the plate. People have started giving themselves vanity alterations in addition to performance enhancing ones. The internet is patched from a local mesh of wires that are strung from building to building, from the underside of the plate down to the ground. This accounts for the imagery of the minor pips. Previous ideas of what it means to be human, imposed by the ruling class, struggle against the people who remake themselves into a thousand different versions of humanity.
And yet something new arrives with a strange, neon pink full moon. Magic begins to surface in the city, along with strange occurrences and impossibilities. Somehow, it seems to be relative in power to the waxing and waning of the moon. 
Each card is meant to evoke a particular piece of this world, using the archetypes available from the Rider-Waite-Smith tarot. I chose tarot specifically to bring this setting to life as it allowed me to emphasize the ambiance and themes of the world while letting a larger cast of characters be depicted than other mediums would comfortably allow. As with any tarot deck, every card has a piece of story behind it, and every combination of cards tells a different story. 
      Out of the goal of $5500, funds are estimated to be allocated accordingly:
Estimated shipping costs - 15% ($825)
Estimated Kickstarter fees - 10% ($550)
Estimated production costs for both versions of the decks, boxes, and booklets - 75% ($4125+personal funds added)
The estimated timeline, and product status is as follows:
Mid-Late March - Campaign ends and funding transfers. Wallpaper+Avatar packs are done and ready to send out. PDF Booklet is also ready to send out. The Neon Moon Tarot Spread and Card Game will be put on the website and added as additional PDFs for backers. I'll place orders with my print shops for decks and booklets. Work has started on the 30-ish page PDF Comic.
April - Depending on order sizes and shipping times, I should start to receive product from my print shops in early to mid April, which I'll start to assemble and send out to backers. While I wait for product to arrive, I'll be letterpress printing prototype cards for the 10k stretch goal. Work on the PDF Comic continues.
May - Except for unexpected shipping delays, most backers should have received rewards. I should be finalizing the PDF comic reward at this point and I'll send it out when it's finished.
    I'm James Brothwell, and this is both my second Kickstarter campaign, and my second complete tarot deck. My first campaign for The Sinking Wasteland Tarot was fortunate enough to not just fund, but to hit all of its stretch goals as well! I've previously been involved with comics, computer games, movies, and the odd commission work that's landed me in strange and exciting places. 
Thanks to the success of the last campaign, I was able to put my nose to the grindstone and finish up The Neon Moon Tarot, and I'm very pleased to be able to offer it for you all now. I started work on this in the last couple of months of 2016 and only recently finished artwork for the last of the cards at the end of January 2018. 
I'm hoping that this deck will speak to those who, like me, are sometimes left wanting for a tarot deck that depicts a more urban environment, and incorporates technology throughout.
Introduction video Music by Gavin Luke.
Explanation video music by TeknoAXE.
Images represent prototypes. Final product may differ slightly.
I do offer worldwide shipping but I'm sorry to say that I have little control over shipping costs or customs fees. If you order from outside of the US, please be aware that I've done my best to keep weights down, prices affordable, and shipping tracked. Still, some things are simply beyond my control. 
Finally, thank you to all of the backers, friends, strangers, and fellow internet oddities whose enthusiasm and support allows projects like this to exist and thrive. Much love. <3

Should we fund, I am ready to commit myself full time to fulfilling orders and getting product out the door as quickly as possible. It is my goal to repeat with this campaign the speed and efficiency that I brought to my previous Kickstarter project for The Sinking Wasteland Tarot.

I'm looking forward to getting these decks into good homes out in the world.

campaign.story:
Hey! Welcome to the redesign Kickstarter launch for Grid Series Two, the typographic playing cards.  
The Grid playing cards are a three part collection based on the design principals of the International Typographic Style, otherwise known as the ‘Swiss Style’ of graphic design. Series Two has been reworked from its original launch because I wanted to refine the design and bring the whole deck closer to the original concept set out by Series One. I feel now, the whole deck has a cleaner more precise and elegant look, one that is important to have in every collection.
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
Originally starting in the 1920s in Germany, the Netherlands and Russia, the ‘Swiss Style’ later developed in Switzerland in the 1950s. It’s main principals are readability and cleanliness, with most creations adopting an asymmetric layout, always based on the use of a grid. These grids, usually made up of hidden columns and rows, are used to align words, numbers, pictures and patterns and so each series in the Grid collection adopts these principals. The works of designers such as Ernst Keller and Josef-Müller Brockmann have been a real inspiration from a graphic point of view. 
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
The cards are poker size and printed by USPCC but are far from traditional. These cards will be printed on linen, magic air cushion stock which I know first hand really does feel like nothing else with fully customised tuck box and seal. As a graphic designer more than an illustrator, as well as a card collector, I wanted to find a way to combine two of my biggest passions and make a collection of decks which truly stand out from the crowd. I fully appreciate the incredible work of designers of other playing cards currently in the world, I am often drawn to the cards with incredible detail and illustration. After all, I am a Kickstarter backer as well as a creator. Personally, I see the detail of my decks as ‘less is more’, doing away with traditional pips and instead adopting a typographic format, with each card acting like a miniature poster, with bold words setting the theme rather than illustration and numbers.
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
I have tried to keep the design minimal but functional, even the back of the card is super stripped back to just the name of the deck, with full colour bleed for real impact of colour. If, for example, you look at my version of the picture cards, they each have a diagonal line introduced as a minimal graphic, like a poster, but it replicates the diagonal line often found on traditional picture cards where the suit is duplicated and rotated. It’s a small detail but it’s my way of reflecting tradition.
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
With Grid Series Two, as well as vertical and horizontal alignment like in Grid Series One, I have introduced the circle to create a dial effect and explore how different grids can be adopted on playing cards. Each card has a bespoke set of alignment with the numbers and letters that sit on the edge of the circle so that they visually look to have the same alignment, whilst not always sitting in exactly the same place on each card.
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
The cards can be read and viewed in many different ways with only two being symmetrical.
A) The card is written in it’s full name; seven of diamonds. 
B) Traditional use in the corners with 7 and the diamond pip. 
C) Written with upper and lowercase next to it; Seven / Diamonds. 
D) Around the circle there is the current sequence of cards before and after; 6 7 8. 
E) Short hand code in the upper right corner; se/di 
F) In the lower left corner similar to Grid Series One, the current card is shown by the pip and lit up dots, with ones that don’t apply being faded out for ace to ten, and then switching to diagonal lines for the picture cards; diamond pip with 7 white dots.
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Each backer will receive 2 free phone background images of their selected cards available for download, as well as a PDF certificate of gratification to download. This is to say thank you and will include your name and backer number. Backers who would like these bonus items just need to message me after funding to confirm selection and I can send the files to them.
Two custom phone backgrounds for every backer
   Signed Standard Edition
If you would like your deck signed, simply increase your pledge by £5 per deck and message me to confirm this add on. You will be able to choose where the deck is signed and if you would like it resealed with protective plastic cellophane.
Limited Edition
The limited edition Grid Series Two deck is an extremely rare product. There will only be 20 made, they will also never be printed again. These will be printed on professional grade plastic coated, lower stock than the standard edition, the same I used for Series One limited edition, this is purely because the print run is so small, I need to use a different printer to get them made. From previous campaigns, I know these are highly sought after, so keeping them so limited increases their exclusivity.
Update - I did post this in my first update but thought best to note it here as well; the limited edition decks are currently all reserved, but if you would like to be added to the waiting list please still do message me!
Grid Series Two - Limited Edition
  Grid Series Two - Limited Edition
Every deck will be numbered and signed in a place of the backers choice. There is no limit to how many decks each backer can request out of the 20 made. Every deck will come with a printed certificate of ownership, signed and numbered to match the deck.
Grid Series Two - Limited Edition

Each deck will cost £25 which includes delivery and certificate of ownership. If you would like to add on any limited edition decks, please private message me directly to reserve a deck and be added to the waiting list. You can do this by going to my creator profile and contacting me from there. Only once I confirm the availability, then you may increase your pledge.
Grid Series One
If you missed out on the first project and are looking to get up to date with the the whole collection, please message me to confirm stock and add on price - I have limited stock left available. Series One is where it all began, don't miss out, these are two decks that every collection needs! 
Grid Series One - available as add on

Single Card Poster
420x594mm (A2 paper size), 200gsm satin finish. Pick any card you like from the deck, front or back, and have it as a poster! The poster will also have your own backer number on there and will be signed on the back. This reward is available to back without the playing cards, or as an add on. 
For UK backers, please add on £12 to your pledge for each poster you would like, or for the rest of the world, please add on £15 per poster.
Single card poster add on
All Cards Poster
960x390mm, 200gsm satin finish. The poster will also have your own backer number on there and will be signed on the back. This reward is available to back without the playing cards, or as an add on.
For UK backers, please add on £12 to your pledge for each poster you would like, or for the rest of the world, please add on £15 per poster.
All card poster add on
Personal Printed Bundle
This unique add-on gives comes in three parts, all for the price of one! 
3 for 1 - Printed Bundle Add-On
Included is a staple bound A5 booklet containing design insight to the Grid collection, as well as my own interpretations of work by designers that have inspired me. With a minimum of 16 pages and printed on 120gsm uncoated paper, take a look inside the grids behind the Grid cards, enjoy a range of other artwork and further details behind the design theme. This will be signed on the inside too.
THREE bespoke A5 prints of any information you like, in the style of the Grid Series Two! You can give me any information you like, from your name, how many dogs you have, where you are from, your favourite number...anything you like, and I will make a bespoke print for you! You can give me three different sets of details, or I can give you it three different ways! each print will be on 220gsm card, and signed on the back of each print. These little keep sakes make a perfect addition to your desk, bedroom wall, or anywhere you like, it's totally up to you. These are like postcards, not a deck of cards.
Stickers! These 70x40mm stickers are weather-proof, so put them wherever you like! Each pack contains 3 stickers, 1 of each design.
The price for all of this is only £8! To add this bundle on, simply increase your pledge by £8 per bundle (2 bundles = £16 etc), delivery is included, and message me to confirm your selection!
Bespoke print, post card style
  As we go through the funding phase, more stretch goals will be added.
£8500 - Dealer's coin / Poker chip Add-On
£8500 - All backers to have the option of receiving printed certificate of ownership and gratitude instead of download, as well as free stickers for those that choose the printed option
£10,000 - Card stock upgrade
So, thank you for taking the time to come to this project and hopefully support it! If you could please ensure to spread the word, share the project on any social media channels too, that would be great! Any questions, please let me know, I always listen to feedback and have close communication with my backers so just shout! 
Feel free to follow me on Instagram  @luke_wadey_design
and tag the project #gridseriestwo #lukewadeydesign
Thank you!

I would love to see you all on the backer list for this project, it is a new challenge and style of design for me (closer to traditional than what you know me for haha). I am aware a couple of your are waiting on your Grid decks to arrive still and I am so sorry about this, when things get lost in transit of course it is out of my control but I have taken steps to make sure your decks get to you asap!

updates.update_content:
Howdy y'all!
Just a small update / reminder to start: all decks have been dispatched and are on their way to you! Some of you have already received your decks which is really awesome! Those of you who opted for signed GS2 decks, these are coming from me in the UK so won't arrive in the same package as any non-signed decks. These may take a little longer to get to you because I had to wait for them to arrive before I could process and send on to you guys, but they are all on their way so keep your eyes peeled!

Good morning everyone!
Just a small update for you, all packages have been dispatched by Gamblers Warehouse now! They have advised me that confirmation codes have started to be sent out by a new automated system they are using, however some of these codes don’t currently give a realistic update to the situation of the package. The courier service varies between USPS and UPS, and they have apologised for any confusion and advised that the codes should begin to work within the next few days. It’s strange I know, I’m in the same situation waiting for some packages as well, but I assure you Gamblers are the best at what they do, and all rewards have now been shipped by them!

Hey everyone,
My apologies for the radio silence, things have been very quiet my side while I waited for USPCC to confirm completion of production.
I am very pleased to see production has now completed so keep your eyes peeled for all your rewards to start arriving!

Hey everyone,
Unfortunately some bad news came this week! USPCC instructed me that all of the decks had been scratched on the production line and would need reprinting. As this was their error, they have fast tracked the process and so we can now expect production to complete in the next couple of weeks. I am so sorry for this delay, I am just as annoyed as you are about this! The good news is we are still ahead of schedule. I have decided to hold back on sending out the limited edition until the standard edition has been shipped to Gamblers Warehouse, this way the decks will be received closer together out of fairness.

campaign.story:
Welcome to our project! 
My name is Mankin Chan and I am a Dutch product and graphic designer with a big interest in playing cards.This is my second custom playing cards project on Kickstarter, after successfully funding Cultura Playing Cards in 2015.
This time I wanted to create a deck that is suitable for both collectors and players. The goal is to provide an alternative for the regular playing cards you use to play games with, but in my own unique flat design style. So I'm proud to present to you: Essentia Playing Cards!
  Features:  
54 fully customized poker size cards
Fully customized tuckbox on matte stock
Printed by LPCC
Classic finish
Casino grade quality
Silver foiling on tuckbox (stretch goal: €6500)
Numbered stamp sticker seal (stretch goal: €7000)
Inside tuckbox printing (stretch goal: €8000)
Essentia is a fully customized deck of cards, with unique artwork on all 54 cards. Designed for both players and collectors.
Court cards 
The court cards are based on standard courts, but completely redesigned from scratch in my own flat design style. I paid a lot of attention to the details that are hinting back to the standard courts. This way the courts are completely customized yet still very recognizable! 
overview of all the Essentia court cards
Aces 
I chose to customize the pips for all aces to make them stand out from the other cards. The ace of spades got some extra attention like usual, with an even larger pip and some decorative texts! 
overview of the aces
Jokers 
The jokers in this deck are represented by The Four Magician Brothers! They each represent their own pip, which is very noticeable when you take a closer look at their clothes. The brothers are divided into the black magicians and the red magicians. Unique jokers that fit the style of the Essentia Deck perfectly! 
The four magician brothers as jokers
Pips 
Set of pips designed from scratch
The pips of this deck all fit within a rectangular shape. The curves of the circles are also matched between the pips as much as possible. By using this framework the pips became a nice coherent set. Completely unique pips in a two tone flat design! 
Number cards
traditionally arranged pips on the number cards
The number cards have traditionally arranged pips, because these cards are also made for players. Traditional arranged pips are best suitable for this!
  The back design of the card is a personal version of the well known argyle pattern. I wanted to increase the detail level by customizing each 'diamond' with nice decorations and pips. A dark and light blue color is used to create a nice contrasting back design that looks both classy for playing and interesting for fanning.
    For the tuckbox design, I wanted to create an overall clean look with the focus on the front and the back. I chose a dark blue main color to give it a sophisticated appearance.The front and back features a variant of the back design pattern in nice contrasting colors. The box will be printed on matte paper that works great in combination with flat design artwork. 
A classy tuckbox with lots of details that will look great in every collection!
And on top of that: the stretch goals will make the tuckbox totally awesome!
You can add various extra items to your pledge, simply by increasing your pledge with the right amount of money.  Here is a list of the cool Essentia add-ons! 
Extra decks
You can add extra decks to your pledge to get the exact number of decks you want. If you want 8 decks for example, you can pledge for the 6 decks tier and add 2 decks by increasing your pledge by the right amount of money. You can find the additional costs in the overview table below.
add extra decks to get the exact amount you want
Leather travel case (+ €17)  
This limited edition travel case will keep your deck clean and crisp when you toss it in your bag during traveling. The case is made of high quality genuine leather and it fits the Essentia deck perfectly. On the front side you will find a nice debossed and silver printed Essentia logo.
Only 100 pieces of these travel cases will be made, so be sure to grab one before they are all gone! (41 left @ 27/02/2018)
Limited Edition genuine leather case
  Close up of the debossing and silver foiling
Uncut sheet (+€30)  
An uncut sheet of the Essentia deck looks great on the wall as a unique decorative item. It is nice to display something different than regular posters or art pieces. These sheets will only be printed once, so they are a great collectors item and serve great as a unique gift!
Essentia uncut sheet (frame not included)
Overview 
If you want to add one of the products to your pledge, simply increase your pledge with the correct amount of money. You can find a list of the add-on prices in the overview table below.
For example: If you want 3 decks and 1 leather case, please select the 3 decks pledge tier and add €17 to your pledge. So your total pledge amount should be €30 + €17 = €47 (€33 + €17 = €50 for international backers) 
Example 2: If you want 2 decks, an uncut sheet and 2 leather cases, please pledge for the 2 decks tier and add €30 for the uncut sheet and €31 for the two leather cases. Your total pledge amount should be €22 + €30 + €31 = €83 (€24 + €30 + €31 = €85 for international backers)
I have set up some stretch goals to add extra features on to the deck after the funding goal is reached. These enhancements will make the decks even more attractive and unique!
    The Essentia Deck will be manufactured by the Legends Playing Cards Company, which is a well known company by playing card enthusiasts. The quality of their decks are among the best of the world. 
To ensure that your decks arrive safe and quickly, Legends will also handle the fulfillment of the decks. They did a great job last time for my Cultura project, and I am sure they will deliver the same quality this time.
If you are wondering what the shipped price per deck is for all the pledge levels and don't want to calculate it yourself, you might find the table below very useful! 
  The exchange rates of euro and other currencies change every day, so this is just an indication of the exchange rates at this moment.  
€1,00 = 1,238 USD
€1,00 = 0,879 GBP
€1,00 = 1,529 AUD
The picture below shows the phases of this project. I will do my best to deliver everything according to this timeline. In the meantime, I will post some project updates regularly to keep you all informed.
    Here are some cool freebies for all backers and visitors of this project: Exclusive Essentia profile badges! Use them for your Kickstarter and/or social media profiles to show that you are a proud backer of Essentia. A great and easy way to help promote this project! 
You can download them on the Essentia Facebook page:
Free Essentia profile badge
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my second Kickstarter project so I have some experience from my first project. With an experienced partner like LPCC, I think I have minimized the risks as much as possible. They did a great job last time and I have no doubt about their professionalism. 

With my experience as a designer, I am pretty confident to bring this project to a success . All the artwork is finished and I am already in contact with LPCC. 

Like in every project, unexpected delays can occur. I will do my utmost best to prevent this and deliver the decks on time. I am aiming to deliver the decks in august 2018. I will keep you all informed about the process with regular updates.

Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions about this project. I will do my best to reply as soon as possible. During the project I will check the comments section regularly.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
